English: 3 Great is the Lord, and marveilous worthy to be praised : there is no end of his greatnesse.
Manx: 3 S’mooar ta’n Chiarn, as yindyssagh, feeu dy v’er ny voylley: ta’n mooadys echey er-skyn roshtyn nyn dushtey.

English: 4 One generation shall praise thy workes unto another : and declare thy power.
Manx: 4 Nee un sheeloghe dt’obbraghyn y voylley gys sheeloghe elley: as soilshee ad magh dty niart.

English: 5 As for me, I will be talking of thy worship : thy glorie, thy praise, and wonderous works;
Manx: 5 Er my hons, loayr-ym jeh dt’ooashley: dty ghloyr, dty voylley, as dt’obbraghyn yindyssagh;

English: 6 So that men shall speake of the might of thy marveilous acts : and I will also tell of thy greatnesse.
Manx: 6 Myr shen dy jean sleih loayrt jeh niart dt’obbraghyn yindyssagh: as nee’ms myrgeddin fockley magh dty vooadys.
vooadys] 1769, 1777 phooar ooilley‐niartal

English: 7 The memoriall of thine abundant kindenesse shall bee shewed : and men shall sing of thy righteousnesse.
Manx: 7 Bee imraa er ny yannoo jeh ymmodee dty chenjallys: as gow-ee sleih arraneyn jeh dty chairys.

English: 8 The Lord is gracious and mercifull : long suffering and of great goodnesse.
Manx: 8 Ta’n Chiarn graysoil as myghinagh: jeh surranse‐foddey, as mieys vooar.

English: 9 The Lord is loving unto every man : and his mercie is over all his workes.
Manx: 9 Ta’n Chiarn dooie da dy-chooilley ghooinney: as ta e vyghin harrish ooilley e obbraghyn.

English: 10 All thy workes praise thee, O Lord : and thy Saints give thankes unto thee.
Manx: 10 Ta ooilley dt’obbraghyn dy dty voylley, O Hiarn: as ta dty nooghyn cur booise dhyt.

English: 11 They shew the glory of thy kingdom : & talk of thy power;
Manx: 11 T’ad soilshaghey gloyr dty reeriaght: as loayrt jeh dty phooar;

English: 12 That thy power, thy glory, and mightinesse of thy kingdome : might be knowen unto men.
Manx: 12 Dy vod dty phooar, dty ghloyr, as niart dty reeriaght: v’er ny hoilshaghey da deiney.

English: 13 Thy kingdome is an everlasting kingdome : and thy dominion endureth throughout all ages.
Manx: 13 Ta’n reeriaght ayds reeriaght dy-bragh farraghtyn: as ta dty ard‐reill er‐mayrn trooid dy-chooilley heeloghe.

English: 14 The Lord upholdeth all such as fall : and lifteth up all those that be downe.
Manx: 14 Ta’n Chiarn niartaghey lhieusyn ooilley ta aarloo dy huittym: as troggal seose adsyn ooilley ta ny lhie fo’n errey.

English: that be] 1662 that are
15 The eyes of all waite upon thee, O Lord : and thou givest them their meat in due season.
Manx: 15 Ta sooillyn dy-chooilley chretoor farkiaght orts, O Hiarn: as t’ow coyrt daue nyn meaghey ayns imbagh cooie.

English: 16 Thou openest thine hand : and fillest all things living with plenteousnesse.
Manx: 16 T’ow fosley dty laue: as lhieeney dy-chooilley nhee bio lesh palchey.

English: 17 The Lord is righteous in all his wayes : and holy in all his workes.
Manx: 17 Ta’n Chiarn cairagh ayns ooilley e raaidyn: as casherick ayns ooilley e obbraghyn.

English: 18 The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him : yea, all such as call upon him faithfully.
Manx: 18 Ta’n Chiarn er‐gerrey dauesyn ooilley ta geamagh er: dy-jarroo, dauesyn ooilley ta geamagh er ayns ynrickys.

English: 19 He will fulfill the desire of them that feare him : he also will heare their cry, and will helpe them.
Manx: 19 Cooilleenee eshyn yn yeearree ocsyn ta goaill aggle roïsh: clynnee eh myrgeddin yn eam oc, as cooinee eh lhieu.

English: 20 The Lord preserveth all them that love him : but scattereth abroad all the ungodly.
Manx: 20 Ta’n Chiarn coadey adsyn ooilley ta graihagh er: agh skeayley dy-lhean ooilley ny mee‐chrauee.

English: 21 My mouth shall speake the praise of the Lord : and let all flesh give thankes unto his holy Name for ever and ever.
Manx: 21 Loayr‐ee my veeall jeh moylley’n Chiarn: as lhig da dy-chooilley chretoor booise y choyrt da’n Ennym casherick echey son dy-bragh as dy-bragh.

English: Lauda anima mea. Psal. 146.
Manx: Psal. 146. Lauda, anima mea.

English: Praise the Lord, O my soule; while I live wil I praise the Lord : yea, as long as I have any being, I wil sing praises unto my God.
Manx: 1 Jean y Chiarn y voylley, O m’annym; choud as s’bio mee ver-ym moylley da’n Chiarn: dy-jarroo, choud as vee’m er‐mayrn, goym arraneyn‐moyllee gys my Yee.

English: 2 O put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man : for there is no helpe in them.
Manx: 2 O ny cur‐jee nyn marrant er prinsyn, ny er veg jeh cloan gheiney: son cha vel veg y chooney ayndoo.

English: 3 For when the breath of man goeth forth, he shall turne againe to his earth : and then all his thoughts perish.
Manx: 3 Son tra ta ennal dooinney er n’gholl voish, nee eh chyndaa reesht gys e ooir: as eisht ta ooilley e choonceil goll naardey.
chyndaa] 1765 chynda; choonceil] 1769, 1777 chiarail

English: 4 Blessed is he that hath the God of Jacob for his helpe : and whose hope is in the Lord his God;
Manx: 4 Bannit t’eshyn ta Jee Yacob echey son e chooney: as e hreishteil t’ayns y Chiarn e Yee;

English: 5 Which made heaven and earth, the Sea and all that therein is : which keepeth his promise for ever;
Manx: 5 Ta er chroo niau as thalloo, yn faarkey, as ooilley ny t’ayndoo: ta freayll e yialdyn son dy-bragh.

English: Which made] 1662 Who made; which keepeth] 1662 who keepeth
6 Which helpeth them to right that suffer wrong : which feedeth the hungry.
Manx: 6 Ta jannoo cairys dauesyn ta surranse aggair: ta beaghey ny accryssee.

English: Which helpeth] 1662 Who helpeth; which feedeth] 1662 who feedeth
7 The Lord looseth men out of prison : the Lord giveth sight to the blinde.
Manx: 7 Ta’n Chiarn coyrt feaysley da ny pryssoonee: ta’n Chiarn coyrt soilshey da ny doail.

English: 8 The Lord helpeth them that are fallen : the Lord careth for the righteous.
Manx: 8 Ta’n Chiarn cooney lhieusyn t’er duittym: ta’n Chiarn goaill kiarail jeh’n vooinjer chairagh.

English: 9 The Lord careth for the strangers, he defendeth the fatherlesse and widow : as for the way of the ungodly, he turneth it upside downe.
Manx: 9 Ta’n Chiarn coadey yn joarree, t’eh shassoo ayns lieh yn lhiannoo gyn ayr, as y ven‐treoghe: agh son raad ny mee‐chrauee, t’eh dy hilgey eh bun‐ry‐skyn.

English: 10 The Lord thy God, O Sion, shall be King for evermore : and throughout all generations.
Manx: 10 Bee yn Chiarn dty Yee, O Sion, ny Ree er son dy-bragh: as trooid magh dy-chooilley heeloghe.

English: The xxx. day.
Manx: The 30. day.

English: Evening prayer.
Manx: EVENING PRAYER.

English: Laudate Dominum. Psal. 147.
Manx: Psal. 147. Laudate Dominum.

English: O Praise the Lord, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God : yea, a joyfull and pleasant thing it is to bee thankfull.
Manx: 1 O moylley‐jee yn Chiarn; son s’mie te dy ghoaill arraneyn‐moyllee gys y Jee ain: dy-jarroo, s’eunyssagh as gerjoilagh te dy ve booisal.

English: 2 The Lord doeth build up Hierusalem : and gather together the outcasts of Israel.
Manx: 2 Ta’n Chiarn troggal seose Jerusalem: as chaglym cooidjagh kynneeyn skeaylt Israel.

English: 3 He healeth those that are broken in heart : and giveth medicine to heael their sickenesse.
Manx: 3 T’eh dy lheihys adsyn ta brisht ayns cree: as coyrt medshin dy laanaghey ny doghanyn oc.

English: 4 He telleth the number of the starres : and calleth them all by their names.
Manx: 4 T’eh coontey earroo ny rollaagyn: as ta ennym echey er dagh unnane oc.

English: 5 Great is our Lord, and great is his power : yea, and his wisedome is infinite.
Manx: 5 S’mooar ta’n Chiarn ainyn, as s’mooar ta e phooar: dy-jarroo, ta e chreenaght er-skyn earroo.

English: 6 The Lord setteth up the meeke : and bringeth the ungodly downe to the ground.
Manx: 6 Ta’n Chiarn soiaghey seose yn vooinjer imlee: as coyrt sheese ny mee‐chrauee kiart rish y thalloo.

English: 7 O sing unto the Lord with thankesgiving : sing praises upon the Harpe unto our God;
Manx: 7 O gow‐jee arraneyn-moyllee gys y Chiarn lesh toyrt‐booise: gow‐jee arraneyn‐moyllee er y chlaasagh gys y Jee ain;

English: 8 Which covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth raine for the earth : and maketh the grasse to grow upon the mountaines, and herbe for the use of men;
Manx: 8 Ta coodaghey yn aer lesh bodjallyn, as jannoo aarloo yn fliaghey son y thalloo: ta coyrt er y faiyr dy aase er ny sleïtyn, as lossyreeyn son ymmyd deiney;

English: Which] 1662 Who
9 Which giveth fodder unto the cattell : and feedeth the yong ravens that call upon him.
Manx: 9 Ta coyrt foddyr da’n maase: as beaghey ny fee aegey ta geamagh huggey.

English: Which] 1662 Who
10 He hath no pleasure in the strength of an horse : neither delighteth he in any mans legs.
Manx: 10 Cha vel eshyn soiaghey jeh troshid cabbyl: cha-moo ta geill echey da cassyn y choshee bieau;

English: 11 But the Lords delight is in them that feare him: and put their trust in his mercie.
Manx: 11 Agh ta taitnys ec y Chiarn ayndoosyn ta goaill aggle roïsh: as ta coyrt nyn dreishteil ayns e vyghin.

English: 12 Praise the Lord, O Hierusalem : praise thy God, O Sion.
Manx: 12 Cur moylley da’n Chiarn, O Yerusalem: cur moylley da dty Yee, O Sion;

English: 13 For he hath made fast the barres of thy gates : and hath blessed thy children within thee.
Manx: 13 Son t’eh er n’yannoo shickyr boltyn dty yiattyn: as er vannaghey dty chloan er cheu‐sthie jeed.

English: 14 He maketh peace in thy borders : and filleth thee with the flowre of wheate.
Manx: 14 T’eh jannoo shee ayns dty ardjyn: as dy dty yannoo magh lesh floor curnaght.

English: 15 He sendeth forth his Commandement upon earth : and his word runneth very swiftly.
Manx: 15 T’eh coyrt magh e haarey er y thalloo: as ta e ghoo roih feer leah.

English: 16 Hee giveth snow like wooll : and scattereth the hoare frost like ashes.
Manx: 16 T’eh tilgey sniaghtey myr ollan: as skeayley yn lieh‐rio myr leoaie.

English: 17 He casteth foorth his yce like morsels : who is able to abide his frost?
Manx: 17 T’eh ceau magh e rio ayns sheebaneyn: quoi ta abyl dy hurranse y feayraght echey?
sheebaneyn] 1769, 1777 peeshyn mynney

English: 18 He sendeth out his word, and melteth them : hee bloweth with his winde, and the waters flow.
Manx: 18 T’eh coyrt magh e ghoo, as dy hennue ad: t’eh sheidey lesh e gheay, as ta ny hushtaghyn roih.

English: 19 He sheweth his word unto Jacob : his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.
Manx: 19 Hoilshee eh e ghoo da Jacob: e ’lattyssyn as e oardaghyn da Israel.

English: 20 Hee hath not dealt so with any nation : neither have the heathen knowledge of his Lawes.
Manx: 20 Cha vel eh er ghellal myr shoh rish ashoon erbee elley: cha-moo t’ec ny ashoonee tushtey jeh e leighyn.

English: Laudate Dominum. Psal. 148.
Manx: Psal. 148. Laudate Dominum.

English: O praise the Lord of heaven : praise him in the height.
Manx: 1 O moylley‐jee Chiarn niau: moylley‐jee eh ayns yn yrjid.

English: 2 Praise him all yee Angels of his : praise him all his hoste.
Manx: 2 Moylley‐jee eh, ooilley shiuish e ainleyn: moylley jee eh shiuish e heshaghtyn‐caggee.

English: 3 Praise him Sunne and Moone : praise him all ye starres and light.
Manx: 3 Moylley‐jee eh, ghrian as eayst: moylley‐jee eh, ooilley shiuish rollaagyn as soilshey.

English: 4 Praise him all ye heavens : and yee waters that bee above the heavens.
Manx: 4 Moylley‐jee eh, ooilley shiuish niaughyn: as shiuish ushtaghyn ta er-skyn yn aer.

English: that bee] 1662 that are
5 Let them praise the Name of the Lord : for hee spake the word, and they were made; hee commanded, & they were created.
Manx: 5 Lhig daue Ennym y Chiarn y voylley: son loayr eh yn fockle, as v’ad jeant; doardee eh, as v’ad er nyn groo.

English: 6 He hath made them fast for ever and ever : he hath given them a Law which shall not be broken.
Manx: 6 T’eh er n’yannoo ad shickyr son dy-bragh as dy-bragh: t’eh er choyrt daue leigh nagh bee er ny vrishey.

English: 7 Praise the Lord upon earth : ye dragons & all deepes;
Manx: 7 Moylley‐jee yn Chiarn er y thalloo: shiuish whaleyn, as ooilley ny ynnydyn dowin.
dowin] 1769, 1777 dowiney

English: 8 Fire and haile, snow and vapours : winde and storme, fulfilling his word;
Manx: 8 Aile as sniaghtey garroo, sniaghtey meen as keay: geay as sterrym, cooilleeney e ghoo;

English: 9 Mountaines and all hills : fruitful trees and all Cedars;
Manx: 9 Sleïtyn as dy-chooilley chronk: biljyn messoil, as dy-chooilley villey cedar;

English: 10 Beasts and all cattel : wormes, and feathered foules;
Manx: 10 Beïyn as maase jeh dy-chooilley cheint: cretooryn snaauee as eeanlee skainagh;
cretooryn] 1765, 1769 creetooryn

English: 11 Kings of the earth, and all people : princes, & all Judges of the world;
Manx: 11 Reeaghyn y thallooin, as dy-chooilley phobble: prinsyn as ooilley briwnyn y theihll;

English: 12 Yong men and maidens, olde men and children, praise the Name of the Lord : for his Name onely is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.
Manx: 12 Deiney aegey as moidynyn, shenn gheiney as paitchyn, moylley‐jee Ennym y Chiarn: son ta’n Ennym echeysyn ny‐lomarcan ooasle, as e ghloyr er-skyn niau as thalloo.

English: 13 Hee shall exalt the horne of his people; all his Saints shall praise him : even the children of Israel, even the people that serveth him.
Manx: 13 Trogg-ee eshyn seose dy-ard niart e phobble; nee ooilley e nooghyn eshyn y voylley: dy-feer cloan Israel, dy-jarroo yn pobble ta dy hirveish eh.

English: Cantate Domino. Psal. 149.
Manx: Psal. 149. Cantate Domino.

English: O sing unto the Lord a new song : let the Congregation of Saints praise him.
Manx: 1 O gow‐jee arrane noa gys y Chiarn: lhig da agglish ny nooghyn eshyn y voylley.

English: 2 Let Israel rejoyce in him that made him : and let the children of Sion be joyfull in their King.
Manx: 2 Lhig da Israel boggey ’ghoaill aynsyn ren eh y chroo: as lhig da cloan Sion ’ve gennal ayns nyn Ree.

English: 3 Let them praise his Name in the daunce : let them sing praises unto him with Tabret and Harpe.
Manx: 3 Lhig daue moylley yn Ennym echey ayns y daunsin: lhig daue arraneyn‐moyllee ’ghoaill huggey lesh tabret as y chlaasagh;

English: 4 For the Lord hath pleasure in his people : and helpeth the meeke hearted.
Manx: 4 Son ta taitnys ec y Chiarn ayns e phobble: as t’eh cooney lhieusyn ta jeh cree imlee.

English: 5 Let the Saints be joyfull with glory : let them rejoyce in their beds.
Manx: 5 Lhig da ny nooghyn ’ve gennal dy-gloyroil: lhig daue boggey ’ghoaill er nyn lhiabbaghyn.

English: 6 Let the praises of God bee in their mouth : and a two edged sword in their hands;
Manx: 6 Lhig da arraneyn‐moyllee Yee ’ve ayns nyn meeall: as cliwe dy ghaa-foyr ayns nyn laue;

English: 7 To be avenged of the heathen : & to rebuke the people;
Manx: 7 Dy ghoaill cooilleeney er ny ashoonee: as dy cherraghey yn pobble;

English: 8 To binde their kings in chaines : and their nobles with linkes of yron.
Manx: 8 Dy chiangley ny reeaghyn oc ayns geulaghyn: as ny deiney ooasle oc lesh driaghtyn yiarn;

English: 9 That they may bee avenged of them, as it is written : such honour have all his Saints.
Manx: 9 Dy ghoaill cooilleeney orroo, myr te scruit: Lheid yn ooashley t’ec ooilley e nooghyn.

English: Laudate Dominum. Psal. 150.
Manx: Psal. 150. Laudate Dominum.

English: O praise God in his holinesse : praise him in the firmament of his power.
Manx: 1 O cur‐jee moylley da Jee ayns e chasherickys: moylley‐jee eh ayns yrjid e phooar.

English: 2 Praise him in his noble acts : praise him according to his excellent greatnesse.
Manx: 2 Cur‐jee moylley da ayns e obbraghyn ooasle: moylley‐jee eh cordail rish e vooadys er-skyn-earroo.
vooadys] 1769, 1777 phooar

English: 3 Praise him in the sound of the Trumpet : praise him upon the Lute and Harpe.
Manx: 3 Cur‐jee moylley da lesh fiyr y chayrn: moylley‐jee eh er y lute as y chlaasagh.

English: 4 Praise him in the Cymbals and daunces : praise him upon the strings and pipe.
Manx: 4 Moylley‐jee eh lesh ny cymballyn as daunsin: cur‐jee moylley da er ny greïnyn strengit as y feddan.

English: 5 Praise him upon the well tuned Cymbals : praise him upon the lowd Cymbals.
Manx: 5 Cur‐jee moylley da er ny cymballyn shiaullit: moylley‐jee eh er ny cymballyn bingey.

English: 6 Let every thing that hath breath : praise the Lord.
Manx: 6 Lhig da dy-chooilley nhee ta ennal ayn: moylley ’choyrt da’n Chiarn.

English: F I N I S
Manx: The End of the P s a l m s .
